name: Bronco AI
headline: AI for ASIC Design Verification
description:
Bronco is an applied AI lab helping chipmakers keep Moore’s law going. Our mission is to build AI silicon verification engineers that find bugs, drive functional coverage, and help companies ship working chips on time.

We're currently deployed alongside verification teams at leading chip companies building next generation hardware (4 nm process node).

We are well-funded and backed by tier-1 investors, including YC, 8VC, Elad Gil, SV Angel, and Contrary Capital. We have also established strong relationships with the leading academic and industry researchers in the field of AI for chip design. Our advisors have won multiple Best Paper Awards at leading conferences, been cited tens of thousands of times, and received some of the highest honors in the microelectronics and EDA industries.

generated_description:
**Company Overview: Bronco AI**

Founded in 2023, Bronco AI is on a mission to revolutionize AI for ASIC (Application-Specific Integrated Circuit) design verification. By serving as an applied AI lab, Bronco aims to help chipmakers maintain Moore's Law—a principle that observes the doubling of transistors in integrated circuits roughly every two years—by developing AI tools that function like silicon verification engineers. These tools are designed to catch bugs, enhance functional coverage, and ultimately ensure that companies can deliver reliable chips on time, even as chip complexity increases.

**Current Operations and Impact**

Bronco AI is already making waves in the semiconductor industry, actively deployed alongside verification teams at leading chip manufacturers working on next-generation hardware using 4nm process nodes. By targeting design verification (DV)—often a bottleneck in chip development—Bronco helps catch errors, clear backlogs, and improve velocity in the development cycle. Their AI can speed up time-consuming DV workflows from hours down to minutes or even seconds, providing a significant competitive edge for firms racing to meet tight deadlines.

**Team and Backing**

Bronco is based in San Francisco and is comprised of a small but dedicated team of five employees, all focused on pushing the boundaries of silicon design. The company has garnered substantial financial support from prominent investors, including Y Combinator, 8VC, Elad Gil, SV Angel, and Contrary Capital. Furthermore, Bronco leverages deep connections with respected academics and industry researchers, some of whom have received prestigious accolades in the microelectronics and Electronic Design Automation (EDA) fields.

**Looking for Talent**

As Bronco continues to tackle challenging technical frontiers, they are on the lookout for ambitious talent in machine learning and silicon engineering. Their growing team is seeking foundational engineers who are ready to build at speed and innovate aggressively in this crucial sector.

For more information, visit their [website](https://www.bronco.ai/) or connect with them on [LinkedIn](https://www.bronco.ai/<https:/www.linkedin.com/company/bronco-ai/>).

In essence, Bronco AI isn't just another startup; it's a determined player aiming to redefine how chip verification is done in an ever-evolving industry. If you’re even remotely interested in the future of semiconductors and AI, keep an eye on Bronco—they might just be onto something big.
